Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg

Class GoalNode

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.Node
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.CostNode
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.GoalNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<CostNode>
public class GoalNode extends CostNode
A goal node represents one branch of a conditional utility node expression. A goal is a condition under which a utility node will have new values of finite cost.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • label

      public final Conditional<Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>>> label
      The condition and utility value this node represents. The condition is represented by the first condition of this expression and the utility value by the first branch. All other conditions and branches of this expression are ignored and not represented by this node.

    • utility

      public final UtilityNode utility
      The utility node this goal will add values to if its condition has a finite cost

    • condition

      public final DisjunctionNode condition
      The condition which, if it has a finite cost, will add values to the utility expression

    • value

      public final FormulaNode value
      The value(s) that will be added to the utility expression if this condition has a finite cost

  • Constructor Details

    • GoalNode

      protected GoalNode(UtilityNode utility, Conditional<Disjunction<Clause<Precondition>>> label)
      Constructs a new goal node that represents a given branch of a utility node's expression.
      Parameters:
      utility - the utility node for which this goal is a branch
      label - a conditional expression whose first condition will be used as this node's condition and whose first branch will be used as the utility values (all other conditions and branches are not represented by this node)

  • Method Details

    • setCost

      protected boolean setCost(double cost)
      Description copied from class: CostNode
      Sets the cost of this node's logical formula being true. The node's cost will only be updated if the given cost is less than the current cost.
      Overrides:
      setCost in class CostNode
      Parameters:
      cost - the new cost for this node's logical expression to be true
      Returns:
      true if the cost was updated, or false if this node's state did not change

    • notify

      protected void notify(Node node, Value value, double cost)
      Description copied from class: Node
      This method is called when some other node in the graph which is important to this node takes on a new value. This method has a variety of uses depending on the type of node, but it is usually called when this node might need to be updated based on an update to another related node.
      Overrides:
      notify in class Node
      Parameters:
      node - the node which took on a new value
      value - the new value taken on by the node
      cost - the cost of that node taking on that value
